comment: A great personality and his lectures are basically works of performative art at this point. He has invested so much effort in making them interesting and unique. Honestly, I wish I had recorded some of them just so I would never forget them.

Dr. Piecuch was arguably the best history professor I ever had. I took a few of his courses over the last couple of years and I was fortunate enough to take one during his final semester at Kennesaw. He truly cared about his students and every lecture inspired me to learn more about American history.

The discussions were SO easy (contribute 3 things like "this sentence stood out" or "what did that mean" and get full credit). The tests were all SA- choose a concept/person from a list (study sessions and study guide gave you everything you needed to know). Lectures got boring, but he'd always make jokes and try to keep people engaged. Loved him!

I absolutely loved Dr. Piecuch! He cares about his students and helps them learn the material. Show up for discussions and participate! Tests are not that hard if you prepare accordingly and study. Go to class because he keeps it structured and interesting! Would highly recommend if you put in the effort

He's a great professor! Knows what he is talking about. Keeps lectures organized and sticks to the point. If you take notes and go to class you'll be fine. Discussion is a huge part of your grade, but if you just show up and contribute somehow he will give you credit. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: You have to write out 10 definitions for exams: Who, What, When, Where, Historical Signficance. Really hard. 3 exams: 20% each, final exam: 20% (not cumulative) and then discussions from readings in the books: 20%

He is a hard grader!!! His test are NOT multiple choice and they are all short essay questions. And if you are not through on his tests he takes points off. There are also mandatory discussions that are 20 percent of your grade. And he DOES NOT drop your lowest test grade. I would avoid him but he is really understanding and tries to be helpful.

Great professor! Lecture heavy but makes them interresting and knows what he's talking about. 4 exams and in class discussions on readings which are like mini quizes and you want to participate in them. If you go to class and take notes and do the readings, you will do well. He even gives you study guides for the exams. Would take him again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: To start, he is a nice and easygoing person and I can recommend him.  However, his tests can be a bit challenging if your not prepared.  (Also, the tests matter so much to your overall grade that a single flunked test will hurt you.) Besides that, his lectures are... well... sometimes a bit mundane, but he does try to make it more interesting.

Two books that you must read and write a short paper for. Other than that we had one test (the final) and a presentation that was ultimately cancelled. Lectures are kinda dry but beware that he really does want you to participate every day. Otherwise he docks you points. All in all hes ok, I would take him again but not first choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not a fan. His lectures are really unstructured and can get kind of rambling at times. He spends ages discussing two books and then has us write two papers on them. We fell really behind the schedule and had to cancel a project which is fine by me. Showing up and participating really matters even though I found it a dull class. Easy grader though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Piecuch is a great professor. Awesome guy. Very understanding about work/family conflicts. Doesn't give busy work. Very fair and smart. Take him

Piecuch was amazing, very passionate about the subject & wants students to succeed. Barely any assignments minus a 20 page research paper that sounds terrifying but he is SO HELPFUL & offers extra credit. Just show up & follow along the readings and you'll get an A & learn a ton along the way! Would take over and over.

Dr. Piecuch is an amazing professor. His subject knowledge is very impressive, but is overcome by his humbleness. Never once have I seen him make someone look stupid for not knowing something.  Lectures are funny, and very informative. Reading is heavy, but he is aware, and assigns good books.  Then, we actually talk about them. So go to class.

Great prof because he simply loves history and wants to teach it.  He is a nice person who is less about rules than about teaching those who are there to learn. If you can write clear, thoughtful, well-constructed papers, do the readings, and participate in class discussions then you're good to go.  A+ class for those who love American history.

Dr. Piecuch is one of the best professors at Kennesaw State.  He is very helpful and truly loves what he does.  He is a great teacher and not just a talking head.  You need to-go-to class and do the reading to get the grade you want. I have taken two class by Dr. Piecuch, and I would take another.

Knowledgeable professor; realistic workload but a lot of reading.   Discussion based class can get a little dull (if everyone isn't participating) but if you read the assignments and show up for class, the rest is easy.  Assignments are relevant and interesting.  There is 20-25 page term paper but no exams.  Good class for history majors.

He assigns 3 books for this class, 2 of which he wrote. Luckily he writes like a he teaches which is similar to story telling. The man knows so much! Do the ALL the reading and expect weekly discussions. So far I've gotten an A and A- on my papers. Take this class if you want to learn about the revolution or just really like history. He's awesome.

Piecuch is a genius. He is also a great professor. Very fair grader. No in class exams. Five Essays. One due every 3-5 weeks. Very easy to talk too. Chill on attendance. Highly recommend for all History and Social Science majors.

Dr Piecuch is amazing and I learned so much from him! This class made me better at research and it should be a prerequisite for ANY upper-level class that requires a research paper. Take him if you plan to go to grad school, you'll be glad you did!

This Man is awesome! Makes History interesting because his enthusiasm is contagious, but he does not expect anyone to feel the same. He is unbiased, positive, and very fair. If you have problems, fall behind, get lost-- talk to him!! He's very fair, understanding, and will go above and beyond to help. HELP achieve your (realistic) goal.
The nicest guy on the planet. Awesome history professor. Very lenient with attendance and paper deadlines. Great sense of humor. TAKE HIM!!

Although we got carried away with the first book, he is a great professor! He gets distracted easily, but is a joy with his quirky personality. Must attend class to get the notes, otherwise you'll be lost!

I took Professor Piecuch for The Early Republic. Take him for any course you can, because he is one of the better history teachers at this university. You will have a lot of papers to write 5-6, but you will get a lot out of the class. Lectures and class participation count, and you will learn a lot from him. I really enjoyed this class. Take him.
great professor, take him if you can, does not take off points for late work!!

I have taken Dr. Piecuch twice and I highly recommend him. He is a treasure. Gives plenty of work, but due dates are reasonable. Always willing to work with students or help in any way. Exams are challenging, but they're take-home. Can't say enough good things about him.

This is a good class.  You learn the mechanics of historical writing. Meaningful exercises. Professor is highly knowledgeable and very effective. He is very accommodating and you can get all the help you need. Good subject too (American Revolution).  Would prefer more interchange and discussion by students and not just answering questions.

I have taken 3 of his classes of his and absolutely love this professor! He is pretty easy, but expect to work for your grade. There is a lot of reading. H eis very clear about what he wants. Attendance isn't mandatory, but is highly recommended. Also he is willing work with you on due dates and if you ask, the exams are take home

One of the best at Kennesaw State. He always makes sure to be clear and give you all the help you need. Funny and if you ask, take home exams. Extremely knowledgeable and can provide you with answers anytime you need them.

One of KSU's stellar best! He's kind, funny, understanding, and down-to-earth. Only qualm for HIST2270? Since there are no tests, there's no reason to read except to participate in boring class discussions. We got off-topic too much because there was no real reason to talk about the material.

Dr. Piecuch is awesome.  His class was always engaging and made you want to attend class. His papers are straight forward and were enjoyable to write.  His lectures were easy to follow except when he started talking about various battles.  I highly recommend him and wished I could take another class with him.

Had a great time in this class; the only complaint is that as "Intro to Themes" I assumed there would be discussion from all parts of history, but instead it focused on the American Revolution. As a world history major this did not go down well for me. LOTS of reading for very few assignments but a great professor and very helpful to his students!
Dr. Piecuch is a wonderful professor who really knows what he is talking about. If You want to learn something--take a class from him. But be prepared to read, write, and talk!

Good teacher, though his long-windedness can get a bit tiresome. Tests were a breeze but readings were mandatory and often exceedingly long. A teacher who doesn't understand the modern full-time job/full-time student schedule. Still, likable guy and good class.

I have taken Dr.P for a couple of classes and I loved every minute of both of them. His lectures are so interesting and he clearly knows his stuff! He assigns his own books as textbooks and, even though I rarely keep my books, I kept these. Go to class and you'll do well. He's exceedingly helpful and just so down to earth. :)
Excellent professor.  Clear, concise, organized, and exceedingly helpful.  Class is predominantly lecture, but lectures are very interesting and detailed.  I highly recommend this professor.
HE IS VERY HELPFUL WITH ASSIGNMENTS AND EXAMS! COME TO CLASS AND PARTICIPATE IN DISCUSSION AND YOU WILL DO GREAT! VERY UNDERSTANDING AND EXTREMELY HELPFUL!

HE is amazing! I am a history major and wish i could have him for every class. he will help with anything!!! he expects you to work hard and read alot. I learned more fom him than anyone at KSU. One research paper in his themes class that was 50% of grade and 25 pages long. He will help you. take him!

He is extremely knowledgeable and a good professor.  He has a midterm and a final as well as a short paper after the first quarter of the class and then a longer research paper due on the last day of class.  I highly recommend Dr. Piecuch to anyone.

He's very knowledgeable and makes the class as interesting as it can be. There is a short paper and longer research paper which are typical of any history class. There's a midterm and final in short answer format but he tells you exactly what he's looking for. Participate in discussions and keep up with notes, he even hints what will be important
Dr. Piecuch was awesome and made a course that I had no interest in fun and interesting.  His jokes are cheesy, but they make class that much more fun.
This is a great teacher. He is very helpful to his students. He makes history fun!

Great class; prof. is very knowledgable and passionate about subject, values opinions and thoughts during class discussions, encourages critical thinking; prof. is also very helpful and gives thorough directions/expectations.
I felt the class was taken a little too seriously for what it was.

Excellent Professor!  His exams are short answer, but he gives you a study guide and tells you what to study.  His 2 papers are easy, and he loves group discussions of the book, and gives you participation for it.  I am taking him again, because he is the most helpfull out of all the history professors.

He is really great! History is NOT my strongest subject. I actually hate it, still got an A! Lots of extra credits. He'll prof read your papers as many times as necessary before u turn them in, Impossible not to get A on his papers. Very knowledgeble and understanding. Extremely helpful! Take him and you'll see for yourself! Good Luck!

He might be the nicest professor i have ever had!  His tests were so easy, and we had 2 papers during the semester.  One was creative and then a research paper.  He is so understanding and if history isnt your strongest subject, you can easily get a B in his class!
